Name: Merry-Go-Sound
Description:
"Merry-Go-Sound is a game that facilitates articulation practice on a variety of levels (word, phrase, and sentence) in an enjoyable way."

This is an educational speech therapy game.

Players move around the board while drawing cards which require them to repeat a word, phrase, or sentence at the target level desired by the therapist. The first player to successful articulate these sounds and reach the merry-go-round wins.

Designed for children ages 5 to 10 years old.

Includes a colorful board, cards, 6 plastic tokens, and a spinner.

Name: Spyro Checkers
Description: Spyro Checkers is a Chinese Checkers variant based on the childrens' video game The Legend of Spyro: The Eternal Night. The board is a 5x7 grid with a starting area on either side. The game pieces feature the likenesses of characters from the video game. The first player to jump his way into his opponents start area is the winner.

Name: What's Your Problem
Description: What's Your Problem is a childrens' game about problem solving. Players move along a path through different areas on the board such as Sad Street, Frustrated Forest, and Surprise City with the ultimate goal of reaching Happy House. Players draw cards with an illustration of a problematic situation such as having to eat food you don't like or feeling ignored. Players then describe a possible solution (there are no wrong answers) and move the number of spaces indicated on the card. There are also special spaces on the board which feature an emoticon-style face which require the player to describe the emotion represented by the face to earn an extra turn.

Name: Metal Warriors
Description:
Metal Warriors is a tank battle game that can be played by two or more players. This is a game played on a hex map or hex terrain. Each player takes on the role of a tank commander and plays tactics cards to manoeuvre his tank for tactical advantage before firing. The basic objective of the game is to eliminate the enemy tank(s).

This game has been heavily influenced by three great games: RoboRally, Wings of War, & The Great Space Race. I would like to acknowledge the clever design elements in those games. Plagiarism is the sincerest form of flattery. The rules for Metal Warriors are free for use and sharing, I only ask that you give credit to their origin. Enjoy your battle.

STATUS: Playtesting Phase II. Rules will be publishing on BGG when this wave of playtesting has been completed.

Name: Sakapuss
Description:
A card game where players to have the fewest parasite at the end of The Game.
Players are dealt four cards of different cats. At each turn, move one card of the player to the left will until someone takes all four cards of the same cat.
Then they should quickly extend your hand in the center of the table and the last to do so will get a letter from the parasite.

Name: SHOLF
Description:
Sholf is a hybrid creation of two classic games. Sholf fuses the accessories of golf with the strategy, competitive play and scoring of table shuffleboard. Played head-to-head, Sholf is wildly addicting and fun for all skill levels. Anyone can play, day or night, indoors or out. Sholf's portability makes it possible to play anywhere, all the time!

If you know how to play table shuffleboard, then you pretty much know how to play Sholf.

The object of Sholf is to putt your golf balls further into the scoring end than your opponent. Point values increase as you get closer to the edge of the playing green. The first player or team of players to 15 wins.

Visit the Sholf website: http://sholf.com/

Name: Nature Dome
Description:
From publishers web site:

Nature Dome is an easy-to-learn, beautifully illustrated dueling card game that includes 50 animal Power Cards, 5 Attack Boost cards and countless hours of fun for players of all ages.

Take turns attacking, defending and escaping as you score hits and diminish your opponent's Health Points. The first player to knock their opponent out wins the round!

It's a fun, family-friendly way to encourage imagination, reinforce addition and subtraction skills, develop strategic thinking and learn about animals from the everyday to the very weird and from all corners of the world.

Each Nature Dome deck is complete and ready to play out of the box; or combine it with your other Nature Dome decks for more dynamic play than ever before.

From Box:
Step into Nature Dome

Where gifted individuals are united and trained to become master warriors who wield weapons as old as the world.

The weapons are nature's fury itself: tooth and claw, hide and bone, limb and tail. Summoned by magic and scaled to your human size, they are yours to control. Because you are among the chosen few to enter... NATURE DOME.

Name: Sport Tietopeli
Description: Very classic sport trivia game from Finland. 3000 questions on 500 cards from every sport category possible, and I mean every. The game is played like a race around the station. Game board is also like a station. There are four rows - one for each player! Among them are colors that represent the question that you have to answer. You answer correst you move on. There are also 100 Joker cards among those 500. Sometimes you get instead of color a picture of a cup. Then it's time for a Joker question. Joker questions are YES/NO answers. The winner is the one who get to the finish first!

Name: Front Est
Description:
A book for Blitzkrieg with


    New army list (Finland and paratroopers for USSR)
    New scenarios and campaigns ( Finland, Barbarossa, and the battle for Berlin) 
    A big map for Kursk

Name: The Coronation Street Game
Description: Each player takes on the role as a Coronation Street character.  Each player must visit 5 locations and collect object cards and rescue one of Jack's pigeons.  The first player to collect all 5 object cards and a pigeon, and return to their starting place and answer a Coronation Street trivia question is the winner.

Name: Solstice
Description:
Solstice is a simple yet challenging table-top farming game guaranteed to spark fun and creativity among everyone playing.

A table-top board game for two to four players, each player plays the role of a farmer. Players get a plot of land to use as they please, with the ultimate goal of bringing in the greatest amount of money over the course of 5 years. At the end of the 5th year, each player sells off everything they have and the farmer with the most money wins!

Name: Call It A Day
Description:
In Call It A Day!, a player is chosen to be storyteller, and begins by drawing one of over 200 Alias cards. The Alias card reveals the character for that round. The character might be a teacher or time traveler, mermaid or movie star, vet or vampire—or one of hundreds of other familiar and fantastical possibilities.

Now it's time to see what might happen in the character’s story. Draw eight of the more than 700 Call It A Day! Activity cards. The storyteller’s job is to tell a story that includes at least six of the eight Activities drawn. The storyteller now weaves a story, arranging the cards in whatever order helps tell the best story.

After the story has been told, the other players rate it from zero to five. The storyteller function then passes to the next player, with each storyteller drawing new Aliases and Activites and telling stories for a predetermined number of rounds. The player with the highest score wins.

Name: Classic BattleTech: Mercenaries Supplemental
Description:
Not every interstellar power can afford the likes of the Wolf's Dragoons. Not every world has the resources to hire even a lance from the elite Kell Hounds. That doesn't mean war doesn't come in the form of objective raids, internal power struggles or outright piracy to such factions and backwater worlds. For such, any mercenary group will do, even the dregs. If they can point and shoot, someone, somewhere, will hire them.

A companion volume to Classic BattleTech Field Manual: Mercenaries, Revised, the Mercenaries Supplemental™ provides an in-depth look at a few of the best and many of the worst known Inner Sphere mercenary commands, including histories, officers, and favorite tactics. Special rules allow players to use these commands in their Classic BattleTech campaigns, while a new point-based construction system provides an optional way to generate mercenary commands.

Name: Thrill Park
Description:
You've got a brilliant idea.  You've got the inspiration.  You've got the backing to get started.  You're going to build an amusement park to attract thrill seekers from all around, and you're going to rake in the money!

There's just one problem...

There are others who share your idea (and your enthusiasm), and you've found yourself in a race to see who can develop their park the most quickly and efficiently.  Will you build a large rollercoaster, or will you add a swinging Pirate Ship?  Will you add a soda stand to compliment that burger stand at the park's entrance?  Do you even have enough money in the bank to build any of these attractions?

Play Thrill Park to see who will attract the largest crowds, and capture the hearts of thrill seekers everywhere!

Name: 007: Il Gioco di James Bond
Description:
From box cover:
You will only be able to defeat the criminal minds which have conceived the greatest conspiracy of all times only if you are worthy of James Bond. But to be successful, you must prove you have the distinctive qualities of the legendary "007" secret agent!
Further to the special James Bond dice, the game also includes 110 illustraded cards with pictures taken from famous James Bond movies.
A real collection for all fans of the adventures Her Majesty's sevret agent has been through!

Contents:
110 special cards
3 special dice
150 punched cardboard tokens
6 plastic "Bond" markers
1 standard plastic marker
1 game board
1 set of rule

Name: Strategy Astrology Game
Description:
This is a Japanese game with some English on the box.  Essentially it's a version of Roulette which also includes set collection.  Players can collect the season (suits) or the twelve signs of the zodiac.  The game comes with a plastic roulette wheel, plastic chips in many sizes and colors, and a chip rack.

The year of publication, 1964, is a guess based on the games shown in an ad flyer in the game which shows a Japanese version of the game Dogfight.

Name: Der Dativ ist dem Genitiv sein Tod: Das kleine Spiel
Description:
Another entry in Kosmos' "Mitbringspiel" line, this is a smaller, easier, quicker version of the full-sized original game, Der Dativ ist dem Genitiv sein Tod.

The game includes 80 double-sided cards and 24 tokens.

Players have to determine the proper, grammatical way to complete sentences in German from a multiple-choice array of answers.
Families: Books: Der Dativ ist dem Genitiv sein Tod

Name: Scene It? Marvel
Description:
The basic Marvel Scene It?

Comes in a 'cardboard' box' and not a tin like the deluxe version.

As with other Scene It? games, the object is to travel around the board and get to the end.  Finishing with an 'All Play To Win' before all others.  If that should fail, each round is a series of questions that get increasing easy as others get a chance to catch up.

Contents
DVD
Game Board
Six sided movement die number one to six
eight sided category die
4 metal player pieces
4 category reference cards
30 'Buzz' Cards
160 Trivia Cards

The game requires that you supply the TV and DVD Player.

The Categories:
My Play - current player gets a question from the DVD
All Play - All Players race to be the first to correctly answer question from DVD
Triple Threat - Answer a trivia question based on three clues
Screen Test - Answer a 'movie' trivia question
Power House - Answer a 'comic' trivia question
'buzz' - draw an 'action' card
Player's Choice - Choice one of the three trivia categories or My Play.

Alternate rules for Longer Games, Shorter Games and 'Party Play'

Name: Time's Up! Deluxe Sample
Description:
This is a small, promotional item/expansion.

It consists of 26 normal game cards, and a 27th card with an abbreviated version of the normal rules.

This item can be played by itself as an introduction to or demo of the game, or mixed in with the cards from the base game.

Name: Time's Up! Title Recall Sample
Description:
This is a small, promotional item/expansion.

It consists of 26 normal game cards, and a 27th card with an abbreviated version of the normal rules.

This item can be played by itself as an introduction to or demo of the game, or mixed in with the cards from the base game.

Name: Dubio
Description: Dubio is a memory game in which you try to collect six balls of your own color. You play with hollow question marks with which you walk around the board, collecting balls of different colors. Every time there will roll a ball out of the top of the question mark. Did you guess the right color of that ball, then you may take it (if it is your color) or replace it on the board (if it is not your color).

4+ exists out of board with holes in which pins can be placed, pins in 2 colors for both players and bars with 4 holes in 2 colors to place over the pins. Your target is to place as many bars over different rows of 4 pins of your own color. This will earn you points. The player with the most points wins. The game goes on until all pins are placed in the board.

Name: Skagaspilið
Description: A trivia game about the town of Akranes in Iceland. The questions come in three levels of difficulty making this an easier game for younger / less knowledgable players than many trivia games.

Name: Bible Battles Trading Card Game
Description:
Ever wonder what it would be like to have King David defend Jerusalem from a horde of Babylonian Chariots? How about having Emperor Augustus lead massive Roman armies in an assault against the Assyrian Fortress of Assur?

Well...Bible Battles TCG brings the Old Testament to life with over 500 unique cards from 6 of the ancient nations. This original and exiting game offers great family fun, and also provides a unique educational tool to help childeren and adults alike to learn about the amazing people and relive the stories from thousands of years ago.

Name: Kipp-Klapp
Description:
Kipp-Klapp is a nicely made balancing game made with quality wood construction.  The game contains a base that holds up a simple from.  Players suspend a round playing surface approximately 5 inches in diameter.  Then players take turns placing the cylinders of different size and color on the circular surface trying to maintain balance.  Players are not allowed to touch the surface at any time.  The player who tips the pieces off the surface loses!

Components include:

base
frame
suspended circular playing surface
42 cylindrical playing pieces in 6 different colors and sizes/weights 
One 6 sided die with a different color on each face
One standard 6 sided die

The game includes four rule set alternatives:

1. Players throw the color die and place a corresponding piece on their turn.

2. Players separate out the cylinders equally between them.  Then on their turn, they throw only the numbered die and place that many cylinders.  Any cylinders that fall off the surface are added to that players collection.  The first player to run out of pieces wins!

3. Players throw both dice and must place the number of pieces of that color.

4. Players use only the color die.  The color of each cylinder corresponds to a point total.  The points are proportional to the sizes, so six white pieces are the same height as one blue, for example.  On a players turn they throw the color die and can place any equivalent size of pieces on the surface.

Name: Honeypot Chase Game
Description: The object of the game is to collect one card of each of the characters (5 cards), or any 10 cards. The cards have two different colours, one on each side. Attach the honey pot collecting pads (with suction cups) to your hands with the velcro strap. Scatter the cards in front of the players, press the randomizer and start hitting the cards with the collecting pads!

Name: Let's Learn Traffic Signs
Description: The children are shown a picture of a traffic sign. The child who can find the sign on his board wins the card. The first player to fill his board is the winner. Later you can play the game so that you show the children a card and they tell you which traffic sign is on it.

Name: I am, I do Travel
Description: The hilarious charades game for the whole family! Can you imagine Dracula brushing his teeth or a frog cooking? In this charades game for the whole family you get to act many crazy and funny things. Roll the two colour dice to decide who you are and what you do, and the other players try to guess it from your gestures, moves and facial expressions. If someone guesses correctly, both you and the guesser move forward on the game pad – but beware of laugh attacks, since a player who laughs at the actor has to move one step back!

Name: Smart 7 Animals and Nature
Description: Smart7 is a set of entertaining and handy sized trivia games for the whole family. Each game contains 700 questions and answers, which are based on fun and exciting themes. The idea of these games is to collect 7 chips by answering correctly to 7 questions. The more you know, the faster you will be on your way to winning!

Name: Smart 7 Children Against Adults
Description: Smart7 is a set of entertaining and handy sized trivia games for the whole family. Each game contains 700 questions and answers, which are based on fun and exciting themes. The idea of these games is to collect 7 chips by answering correctly to 7 questions. The more you know, the faster you will be on your way to winning!

Name: Trivia Game Animals and Nature
Description: 350 questions & answers and simple rules. The questions are about the wonderful world of the animals. The one who get more right answers - wins!

Name: Trivia Game For The Whole Family
Description: Separate questions for the grown-ups and the kids, and simple rules. In this trivia game the children can compete with adults. Get more right and you've won!

Name: Trivia Game Myths And Legends
Description: 350 questions & answers and simple rules. The questions are about characters, creatures and events from the world of fairytales. Get more right for the end, and you've won!

Name: Wargamer's Guide to PanzerBlitz
Description:
The Wargamer's Guide to PanzerBlitz contains articles that examine various aspects of Avalon Hill's classic wargame side-by-side with variants and a host of new scenarios. It appears that a few of these articles originally appear in The General.

Articles Include:
Pieces of Panzerblitz (a unit by unit examination of pieces: both their historical context and how best to use them in game.)
Beyond Situation 13 (More Panzerblitz scenarios - outlines Scenarios 14-25)
Another Situation 13: Parablitz (Airmobile Panzerblitz)
Panzernacht (Night Panzerblitz Rules)
Blind Panzerblitz (Refereed-hidden-movement rules)
Chopperblitz (Helicopters in Panzerblitz)
Panzer Situation 13 (Another Panzerblitz Situation)
More Panzerblitz Variants (As the title suggests)
Commander's Note Book - Analyzing the 12 Scenarios (An analysis of the 12 Situations from PanzerBlitz)
Championship Situations (Covers the Tournament Situations used for PanzerBlitz games at GenCon 4 - The GenCon where PanzerBlitz was the only game officially played)
Panzerblitz Concealment (Variant to reduce the effectiveness of concealment)
Incremental PanzerBlitz (Alternate movement rules).

Pages: 36
Book measures: 8.5x11x.18"

Name: The Sword and the Flame: The Sun Never Sets
Description:
"Being in the main a practical Campaign System for the Colonial Wars of the British Empire."

A miniatures campaign system to be used with The Sword and the Flame, The Sword and the Flame: Eight Hundred Fighting Englishmen and Boilers and Breechloaders.

Currently in its third edition published in 2006.

Name: Humpuuki
Description: The hysterically funny party game in the spirit of Rappakalja! Altogether 400 double-sided cards full of pictures of the weirdest objects in the world, and you will have to make up crazy explanations of what the objects are used for. All the explanations are then judged by all the players – the catch is that you never know beforehand what argument the judgement will be based on – it might be, for example, the most old-maidish, the most fashionable or the saddest explanation that wins on this round. The winners on each round get to move forward on the game board. The first player to reach the finish wins the game! So… pull out your best and most absurd explanations, and you might be the Master of Mumbo Jumbo!

Name: Trivia Game About The World
Description: 350 questions & answers and simple rules. The questions are about distant countries, popular travel destinations and Finland. As like with all games in this series, the one who has most right answers by the end, is the winner!

Name: Pop Music Trivia Travel
Description:
The hugely popular Pop music trivia game now available also as a travel version! The game contains 100 question cards – the questions deal with songs, singers/bands, lyrics and competitions both from the days gone by and today.

Unlike the basegame, the travel edition has no board at all; each player is given a page off a pad, which has six 'pyramids' (good for six games) made of 9 circles in the colours of the four question categories - three categories have 2 circles each, while one has 3 circles, and this varies from pyramid to pyramid. In the middle is a white star which is the final game-winning question. Each time a question is answered correctly, one circle of the category in question can be crossed off, and the goal is to fill in one side of the 'pyramid' and then answer the final question correctly. The category is decided directly by a die-roll (5 or 6 means player's choice). Otherwise rules are the same as the basegame.

Name: John Deere Family Farm Board Game
Description: Create and manage your own successful farm with the John Deere Family Farm Board Game.  You’ll decide which crops to plant, which equipment to invest in, how much fuel to buy, how to seed/harvest your land and when to buy more land.  Flood, insects, equipment, subsidies and much more will play a role as you make decisions that will determine the ultimate success of the farm.  The player with the most assets at the end of the game is the winner.  Includes large quad-fold game board, 24 land parcels, 6 hat pawns, 6 tractor pawns, 1 silo pawn, card, play money and instructions.

Name: El Chavo
Description: Join El Chavo and his friends as you work your way through the neighborhood to reach El Chavo’s barrel.  Join in El Chavo’s favorite activities and become the first to get to the end and win the game.  It’s El Chavo at his best…Eso, eso, eso!  Includes El Chavo game board, character pawns, ball in the barrel, catch the clock, marbles, cards and instruction.

Name: El Chavo Ham & Cheese Sandwich Card Game
Description: Race to build your ham and cheese sandwiches in this good-enough-to-eat game.  Be the first player to build three sandwiches in the correct order and you win the game.  But watch out!  An opponent with an Nono card can steal part of your sandwich, while the fly can ruin the whole lunch!  No reading required.  Includes 54 cards, plastic fly and instructions.

Name: Star Trek All About Trivia
Description: Attention Trekkies, the ultimate Star Trek trivia game is now available.  Be the captain of your own starship where your knowledge of the Star Trek series influences your success.  With 1000 questions every Trekkie with have to beam-up to the challenge.  Contains trivia question cards, game board, playing pieces and dice.

Name: Twister Moves: High School Musical
Description:
Game puts a new, High School Musical-themed spin on classic game of Twister

Features 4 songs and 4 dance sequences from "High School Musical"

Kids can dance along to the beat with favorite High School Musical characters

Comes with 2 CDs filled with "High School Musical" music

Recommended for ages 8 and up

Based on the smash Disney hit, "High School Musical," this game from Hasbro puts a new spin on the classic game of Twister. It features four songs and four dance sequences from "High School Musical," and kids can dance to the beat with their favorite High School Musical characters. Recommended for ages 8 and up, it is perfect for both fans of the movie and fans of dancing in general.

Name: The Godfather Trivia Game
Description:
The Godfather trivia game features 900 questions from all 3 award winning movies. Who was Kay talking about when she told Michael: "Look at that skooky looking guy!"? How many Oscars sis all three film won? Who said: "LEave the gun. Take the cannolis!"?
Earn points, and snuff out you opponents as you relive all the drama and excitement of the Godfather: the epic saga of a passionate family and their cold blooded crimes. Rise through the ranks, or sleep with the fishes... in the Godfather Trivia Game from Endless Games.

Name: Diceman Baseball 2010
Description:
The smell of peanuts. The freshly-cut grass. The loud crack of the bat. (All sold separately.)

PDSN Diceman Baseball is a brand new, physical game from the previously-digital/theoretical minds at Pacdude Games. Simulate America's Pastime with a bunch of dice and cards. Including 52 player cards and 30 special Power Cards to swing the game for the home or away team. Each card is personalized with player bios and those fantastic PDSN graphics for a sleek, fun game.

Wondering what we're simulating in this game? Well, we have strikes, balls and outs, home runs, base hits, sacrifice bunts, suicide squeezes and more. It acts like baseball, it plays like baseball, just without all that pesky "running" and "sweating."

Great for 2 players, with minimal table space needed. Play it in a bar, play it at the game (if the game isn't too exciting), or play it anywhere you like. It's the fun of baseball, all in a tiny box.

Name: Construction Whist
Description:
Construction Whist
Thin veneer of theme: players are pyramid builders in ancient Egypt

Take one deck of cards, remove any jokers.

- Turn over the top card; of the deck; this is trumps.
- Shuffle the deck
- Deal 13 cards to each player
- Choose a first player for the round

Each round consists of 13 construction tricks, in which the players bid for raw materials to extend their pyramids. In each phase, perform the following steps:
- turn over two cards from the draw deck
- first player plays a card
- second player follows suit if possible, trumps or discards if not
- the WINNER of the trick 
-- MUST extend their pyramids with one of the two cards face-up on the table
-- MAY further extend their pyramid with the card they played
- the LOSER of the trick MUST then extend a pyramid with the other face up card, but can not use the card that they played.

Extending a pyramid.
- Each pyramid consists of a stack of cards in a suit. 
- Each card must be played on a card of higher rank, so the numbers gradually descend.
- Each player can only have one pyramid in each suit
- If a player MUST play a card on a pyramid, but can't, then they have to demolish their pyramid and start again with the new card as the base

At the end of the game, players score points for each pyramid equal to the number of cards in the pyramid squared.

Name: Kwiqwit
Description: A game of logic for 2 players where you must guess your opponent's secret numerical code. A deduction game where the codebreaker takes turns making a limited number of guesses, using logic to deduce the codemaker's secret code.

Name: Laugh Trax
Description:
Play is simple, the challenge is NOT!
You laugh...you lose! At specific board locations, players stare each other down as a timer determines who will be the first to lose their composure. Neither can laugh or even grin... The first to do so loses! To increase this challenge, your opponent is staring at you wearing a pig nose or any one of the six props shown. Other players are free to talk, laugh, and attempt to sabatoge the dueling pair. As the game progresses, determination snowballs into explosive laughter that roars out of players as their twitching stomachs can hold back no more! "Victory" is relative since all of the "losers" are sore from laughing! We guarantee it! Get LAUGH TRAXtm and discover why losing is now FUN!

Includes: Game board, timer, die,
6 props, directions, and playing pieces.

Name: A New World
Description:
A New World is a multi-player, card-driven, area-control game, where players assume the lead of a major European nation during the XVI-XVIII centuries. Players will have to manage economy, policy, diplomacy, trade, world wide exploration, colonization,  religion, warfare in the effort to achieve supremacy. A New World offers an accurate and detailed historical context, supported by more 220 game-cards: players will have to deal with historical events performing to achieve better result than the historical nations did. Europe, Mediterranean Africa and Middle Eastern Asia figure out in the game map. World wide explorations and colonizations are managed by a set of dedicated game cards. Tons of political and military leaders have been added to the game by unique game counters. The victory tracking system of the game has been built to grant an open-end of scenarios by opponent hidden factors and bonuses to be claimed at the conclusion of the campaign game.

This game design project has been abandoned in October 2010.

Name: Nuklear Winter '78
Description:
The former German territory, transformed into a wasteland by the nuclear holocaust that ended the Second World War in 1946, is the hostile setting of a new conflict between old enemies clenched in a struggle for the future of mankind.

Surviving Nazi leaders and Wehrmacht forces resurface in 1978 from underground shelters to rebuild an empire from the ashes of the world. Oblivious of the climatic, technological and political changes inflicted by more than 20 years of nuclear winter, they are about to face the mysterious Black Hand - elusive, abhorrent  masters of the wastes, and the combined might of the modern, highly mechanized and versatile NATO alliance.

Nuklear Winter 78 was a free print & play, tactical, platoon level simulation. The 15 campaign-linkable scenarios for 1-3 players depict the triumvirate struggle for power around Wewelsburg in the former central Germany, now a barren wasteland known as the Zone. The game contains:

     one rulebook (24 pages)
     one playbook (20 pages)
     one single sided map
     two countersheets (280 counters)
     three player aids


 
 


    
         News 2/3/2010

    
    
         Nuklear Winter is no longer a Print & Play game as it is in re-development to be produced as a game for Lock 'n Load Publishing, LLC. under the title Nuklear Winter '68

    



Re-implemented as Nuklear Winter '68.

Name: The Scramble for China
Description:
BackgroundIt is the middle of the 19th Century, and China is about to descend into a period of chaos and rebellion.  Weakened by a decade of humiliation from foreign powers following the Opium War, the Qing Imperial Government is at odds with itself about how to rule the country.  One side argues that China should adopt Western practices and institutions in order to level the playing field abroad.  The opposition claims that China must continue to stand defiant of foreign influence and forge its own path.  At the same time, a failed Confucian scholar in a desolate region of the South has recently proclaimed himself a high place in a foreign religion--the younger brother of Jesus Christ.

So moved by his visions, he begins gathering followers to act against the government whose Confucian ideals had ranked him so poorly.  The pool he draws from consists not only of those who had been downtrodden and forgotten by the massive and corrupt governmental bureaucracy, but also wealthy families who believe a Han Chinese national could lead their people much better than the foreign Manchu from the North, who had conquered China almost two centuries before.

This prophet's name? Hong Xiuquan

His mission?  To expunge the Manchu demon rulers from the Han kingdom and usher in a new era of peace and prosperity on Earth.

The eventual death toll?  Over 20 million.

Welcome to the Heavenly Kingdom of Greater Peace--Taiping.

				
				
					Game InformationThe Scramble for China is a two player war-game set in the most destructive period of the 19th century, the Taiping Rebellion.  You either play as the Taiping, a pseudo-Christian movement that is sweeping South and Central China and wishes to topple the Manchu-run government and create a new culture for China, or the Qing dynasty, an incompetent gigantic imperial administration that is trying to hold the country together and stop the momentum of the Taiping.

Players progress through the game using cards drawn into their hand; the cards either have an event written on them or a number of Action Points, and players take turns playing cards one at a time.  Action Points allow the players to recruit armies(colored blocks), form up troops into different types of units and attack the enemy.  During the course of the game both players can call upon foreign soldiers to get the edge in battle, and the Taiping will try and meet up with rebels in nearby provinces to add manpower into their army.  Victory goes to whichever side has the most victory points at the end of the game.  Most victory points are earned by holding red city spaces at the end of turn 8, but the Qing player gets bonus points for every city never lost, and the Taiping player for every rebel piece picked up.

A third Non-Playable faction exists in the game through 'The West'.  'The West' steals points from the Chinese players for every foreign unit on the board at the end of the game, randomly receives points for how much attention it is paying to China through 'The West' deck, and earns points from player card events and Chinese casualties.  It is very possible that both Chinese players will lose and the West triumphs, so Chinese players must be weary in how they utilize foreigners...

Name: ESPN Jeopardy Attaché Edition
Description: America's favorite quiz show meets ESPN in this handsome, take-anywhere edition. Use your clicker to get control of a question in categories such as: ESPN players You Love To Hate, Ballparks & Arenas, ESPN Personalities, NFL Brothers, NBA Head Coaches and dozen more. Collect chips for each correct answer as you make you way to FINAL JEOPARDY!

Name: Hello Kitty Happy Seasons game
Description:
It's Hello Kitty fun - throughout the year! Travel around the game board collecting question cards. Be the first player to make it through the year and win! 
Bonus: includes Hello Kitty wrist bracelet!

Name: The Golf Game
Description:
From Box Back:  18 holes of golf with nine holes on the front and nine holes on the back.

The Golf Game gives you everything you could ask for in a round of golf. Longest drive, iron shots, pitching, putting water hazards, out of bounds, sandtraps, and much more.

This game is as close to real golf as you can get without ever leaving your home.

Challenge Cards: With 3 levels of play: Junior, Amateur, and Professional.  All questions are golf related to help you eliminate penalties, teach you all about the game of golf, and challenge those who know everything about the game.

Also Included are: Score Cards (to register all the strokes of each player), Easy to follow instructions (to give you all the help you need to play the game), The Golf Club Spinner (used for your drive, iron, pitching, and putting... even that hole-in-one you have been looking for).

Options: Skins game, Point system, and Best ball are alternate ways to play the game.

Name: Exxxtasy
Description:
The game for gay men that takes you and your partner through a dizzying array of sensuous thrills.

Picture cards guide you through a series of sexy trials. But be careful! No matter how excited you get you have to keep your passions in check. Otherwise you lose the game!

You'll find that finishing the game is a feat in itself. So take a deep breath, keep your cool, and let Exxxtasy add a little spice to your evenings... Enjoy the game!

includes:
1 board
4 decks of cards
1 die
1 hourglass
2 tokens

Name: Tantric Lovers Game
Description:
Tantra is an ancient practice focusing on the art of lovemaking, blending the flow of Yin (female) and Yang (male) energy for a profound mind, body and spirit connection. The Tantric Lovers Game is an experience for the two of you to learn Tantra and achieve that "ulimate" conectedness.  
Created for any loving couple (from 18 to 80), this fun and easy to play game presents basic and advanced Tantric techniques and activities enabling the two of you to expand your sensual and sexual horizons. You will appreciate each other and discover a richer, more rewarding life together, and a more gratifying emotional bonding.  
 For a Woman, the game enables her to feel sexually empowered, fulfilling and satisfying her needs and desires (as well as her lover's). For a Man, it provides him with tools to become multi-orgasmic and to satisfy, cherish and please his lover in intimate ways she can genuinely appreciate. For a Couple, the experience can expand or rekindle your love, intensify passion, enrich and enlighten your relationship. Did I mention prolonged, mind-blowing, sensual sex?
There are several ways to win or to lose this game, depending on the rules you have chosen. Sometimes might be better to lose, if you know what i mean!

Included in The Tantric Lovers Game:

* Instructions
    * Two-sided Game Board
    * 2 Glass Playing Pieces
    * Timer
    * Die
    * Chakra Chart
    * 2 oz. Raspberry Edible Lubricant

Name: Oral Sex! The Game
Description:
The game for couples who love oral sex! Orally tantalize your lover as you move your lube-filled game markers around the board. Reach the tongue first and your reward is Oral Sex! 
 The game includes:

* 11 in. x 7 in. game board
    * Die
    * 2 flavored lube game markers (each holds .25 fl. oz. of lube)
    * Easy-to-follow game rules

Name: Stairway to Pleasure
Description:
You'll find this game to be a spark to your love life. It was designed to stimulate and enhance those special moments between you and your lover. It is a way of bringing back or creating new emotions and desires you thought were gone. It's perfect for all couples, whether you're long time partners or in a new relationship. The true object of this game is to relax, drop your inhibitions and totally enjoy the love between you and your partner.

Whether given as a gift or for personal use this game in guaranteed to heat up the night. Players start at one end of the board and work their way across to the finish line. All while answering "Truth or Dear" questions or fallowing direction on the "This Could Be Embarrassing" cards. The winner of the game gets to make a Special Wish that there opponent has to fulfill immediately.

Name: Exxxtasy Female
Description:
The game for gay women that takes you and your partner through a dizzying array of sensuous thrills.

Picture cards guide you through a series of sexy trials. But be careful! No matter how excited you get you have to keep your passions in check. Otherwise you lose the game!

You'll find that finishing the game is a feat in itself. So take a deep breath, keep your cool, and let Exxxtasy Female add a little spice to your evenings... Enjoy the game!
Be the first to reach the end and make your wish that the loser will have to make true!

includes:
1 board
4 decks of cards
1 die
1 hourglass
2 tokens

Name: Embrace Board Game
Description:
Embrace is a sensually stimulating board game for lovers. Players move throughout the board revealing sexually intimate thoughts and feelings, and performing erotic challenges with one another.

Participants play on a beautiful board, performing sensual and exciting tasks. The game can be played on three different levels: Romantic (Lovey Dovey), Sexual Intimacy (Close Encounters), and/or Hot Sex (Sexstacy). You choose the level depending on what you wish to enhance in your relationship. Interactive truth and dare squares on the board allow players to be as naughty or as nice as they choose.

You’ll find yourself shedding your inhibitions and becoming more aware of your sexual self. To win, a player must land on the ‘Embrace’ square, which then entitles that player to a sensual treat that both players can enjoy. Embrace makes the ideal gift for any romantic or sexual occasion.

To find a store near you that carries Embrace or to purchase the game online, contact info@copulus.com

Name: 101 Nights of Grrrrreat Sex
Description: Players take turns answering erotic trivia questions, performing seductions based on instructions written on selected cards. The game includes the game board, game markers, a die, Secret Sealed Seductions cards, a notepad and pencil as well as two erotic trivia books. The game is based on Laura Corn's New York Times bestselling book of the same name. Winner will be the one who will get more right answers and more successful commands!

Name: Behind Closed Doors
Description: This couples-only board game makes getting to erotic play even more fun. The object of Behind Closed Doors is to be the first to make it to the Winner's Circle; however, along the way each player must perform small, sensual acts such as setting the mood, removing an item of clothing or making out with their partner, as well as collect Foreplay, Positions and Items cards. The first player to finish gets to then incorporate all of the collected cards into the ultimate lovemaking session!

Name: I've Never... The Outrageous Game of Truth
Description: To play, roll the die, move your playing piece, and follow the instructions on the board where you land. For example, you may be told to read aloud an I've Never Card, which might say something like, "I've never had a lemonade stand" or "I've never had a pet goldfish." You then have to admit whether the statement is true or false, for which there are further exciting or funny consequences, depending on your answer. you may have to dance, sing, imitate your best friend, spin 5 times in a circle, and answer outrageous "I've Never...®" questions. Family friendly.

Name: Bible Basketball
Description:
Essentially a timed Bible trivia game with questions that a high school kid who attended a Christian school could answer.  There can be two players or teams of players, along with one quizmaster.  Games can be two 15-minute halves or four 8-minute quarters.

Sample Question:
Hook shot; two points.
Q: What was the name of the angel who told Mary she would be the mother of Jesus?
A: Gabriel.

Name: OPFOR: Opposing Force – The Grunts
Description:
WAR HAS BEEN DECLARED! Build your Basecamp... Assemble your troops... Devastate the OPPOSING FORCE!!!

OpFor: Opposing Force™ is a customizable strategic card game in which you take command of a modern military force.

Build your basecamp consisting of Barracks - you'll need these to deploy your Personnel to the Battlefield 
Send in your Infantry and go head to head with your enemy 
Use your Medics save your defeated soldiers from being removed from the Battlefield  
Demoralize enemy forces by sending your Snipers to the Battlefield. 
Dish out orders to your troops by using the Special Action cards to perform tactical maneuvers on your enemy, giving you the edge you need to succeed in combat
Earn rewards by completing Special Missions
It's total chaos on the Battlefield as you struggle to keep the Opposing Force at bay while ensuring the survival of your General.

Wipe out the enemy forces or kill the General to claim your victory!

The Boot Camp Boxed Edition is a starter set that includes 2 forty-five card preconstructed Skirmish Decks representing 2 Platoons. Each Platoon consists of 1 General, 12 Soldiers, 3 Medics, 1 Sniper, 15 Barracks, 10 Special Action cards and 3 Special Mission cards.

BUILD A FORCE TO BE RECKONED WITH!!! COMING SOON: OpFor: Opposing Force™ expansion packs that allow you to build a more deadly fighting force:

Supply Dumps and Motor Pools to add to your Basecamp
Weapons and Equipment for your soldiers in battle
Mechanized Infantry: powerful soldiers to add to your growing force
Battle Tanks and Field Artillery to bombard your enemy's Basecamp
Anti-tank Vehicles to get rid of those pesky enemy Tanks
Navy SEALs for those sneaky missions behind enemy lines
All new Special Action and Mission Cards
New Generals with new Special Abilities

COMING THIS FALL:

OpFor: Opposing Force™: Metal Monsters - a stand alone armored vehicle combat card game
OpFor: Opposing Force™: Flyboys - a stand alone aerial combat card game
OpFor: Opposing Force™: Deep 6  - a stand alone naval combat card game


        A portion of the procedes from the sale of OPFOR will be donated to Operation Homefront, a charity that lends help and support to the families of our service men and women. If you want to get involved, go to operationhomefront.net

Name: Rush-Hour
Description: Rush Hour With thanks to Stock Classic Card Games. This is a British card game of "unceasing thrills and fascination" by Universal Publications Ltd. The object is to make up sets of six cards to a value of 50. It is based on transport - planes, cars, coaches etc. The box says that it is for Children aged 5 to 50.

Name: Sateenkaari
Description: At last a game for the smallest! You have a rainbow, which is missing six colors. Throw dice and collect all the rainbow colors that are missing. Rainbow is a game that teaches identify colors and patterns. All its parts are safe for 2-4-years old toddler. A player who first gathers all the six rainbow missing colors wins the game!

Name: 3 Little Pigs and the Big Bad Wolf
Description: Exciting game for the youngest of family! Who is afraid of the big bad wolf? This game is a little adventure towards safe stone house, which rescued them from danger. The game can be played with 2-4 players who each receive pork. Piglets built straw house, stick house and finally the stone house, in that order. But the task is not easy. Hungry and always on guard Big Bad Wolf waits impatiently for the moment when it could blow down the houses of the piglets. You win the game if you reach the stone house without the wolf catching you!
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Three Little Pigs

Name: Bananas in Pyjamas
Description: Friendly fun and exciting game for the smallest family. Can you get Amyn, Morgan and Lulun around the game board and finish the game board before the  Banana 1 and Banana 2 are attached to them? Watch out, one mistake and you start over again.

Name: Birthday Party
Description: Birthday party game is a delicious birthday cake. Your job is to chip yourself a juicy piece of cake by dice throwing. The question, however, is not just a normal piece of cake, because you'll need to assemble the layer-layer plate candles always bottom up. Cuts to be taken whenever the dice seems to shift to a picture of the piece. The task is challenging more than you think - dice is a tyrant! Winner is the one who gets more pieces.

Name: Karkki vai kepponen?
Description: It is a dark and stormy Halloween night ... You are moving around the city to get candy, but candy eager Pumpin Head is trying to catch the Halloween-night walk on, but it is stopped by its fear of ghosts. Grumpy old man would not hold the Halloween party, so all children must stay outside. The one who gets more candy by the end and will not be caught by the Pumkin Head is the winner!

Name: Kissa Vieköön!
Description: Daft cat stalks the table to return to have a taste for themselves. Can you find the goodies before the other players? In this fun memory game, players try to find a table of dishes. Around the table is a different color chairs and if you have the right colored chair cards, you will check out the cups and see what the game board is hiding. When you find a plate to your own dishes, you're one step closer to a winning! A good memory is needed, because the board changes place all the time. In addition, the cat is complicated by a pattern by moving to another chair and deceive you as to forget to use your own memory! Winner is the one who gets more dishes with food!

Name: Lumottu Metsä
Description: Enchanted Forest is in danger! Malevolent witch has stolen enchanted forest to protect the crystal wizard, violated it and the hidden pieces of the woods. The children rush wizard to help save the forests by applying crystal pieces velholle. But the dark journey back of the Forest is an exciting and slightly dangerous, because the forest is guarded by flying witch Taikoo who changes all children to different frogs! Only a wizard can help in this situation. The player who first brings velholle three crystal pieces, wins.

Name: Maa Aikojen Alussa
Description:
An exciting adventure! Dinosaur game for the little ones in the family. Four different dinosaur adventure in the dinosaur land visiting dense jungle, volcanic root and dry desert. The player should make an effort in this game and retrieve the cards. The player who first find all the four cards and get the home in its cave, it is a game winner.

Part of The Land Before Time series of dinosaur-themed games for kids.

Name: Taika Kengät
Description:
Children's fairy tale fascinating game! The Magic Shoes has four adventures fairy tale countries. Elves need to collect five diamonds, which means they cancel out the evil vicious witch. Elves need different kinds of shoes to be able to travel over the fairy tale country. A pinch of luck in your  Magic Shoes is need, which makes easier movement over storybook countries. To win the game the player who first receives collected five diamonds and gets the witch in jail. Join the adventure!

This is a mild reworking of the 1974 Joker game Seven League Boots.

Name: Taitavat Uimarit
Description: Collect cool animal pictures, which consist of three pieces. Get points for each completed picture of your animal. The game contains 15 different types of colorful animal images and a game you can play three different ways. You'll also get a wonderful booklet that allows you to add information to the game animals.

Name: Lippupeli Spectrum olympiapainos
Description: A fun and educational information game for all ages! The game contains 100 cards, which the other side of the state flag and the other side of interesting information from that State. Included are all the most Olympic medals won states, as well as Olympic Games and the Olympic winners of the issues. The rules also easier to play version of pre-school children.

Name: Porrii-eks tiä?
Description: Porrii eks-tion? is a spellbinding game of information to all beautiful cities interested. City street pattern based on the game board to move the dice throwing Church, City Hall and Town Hall angles. Pawns each get to choose who they would like the character: Duke, Pelle Hermann, Porin bears, known musician or stew shirt. During the game responds to questions and a picture-riddles and Pori pori kinds. Correct answers will take you speed ahead described in the center of the streets. The winner is the player who manages to collect the first 8 game characters!

Name: Sydän sanoo
Description: Cardiac says girls have a game where you are dating. The stakes are responsible for all kinds of crazy and mad discipline issues, and select your dream boyfriend of several among the boys. Gorgeous electronic heart will tell on how well you and the boys agree with! Write the answers to your diary, and when the game ends, you get to know how the other girls were able to date and whether your dream boyfriend really the best option for you! The most match points is the winner!

Name: Torreta
Description: Torreta is a wood block game with colorful wood blocks and dices. Dice results are printed onto the wood blocks. Players have to build a tower with these pieces with great care. The one who stacks the bricks is the winner.

Name: Kim Possible Mission Alarm in New York
Description: Kim and her friends are searching for the secret hiding place of the crooks! From a helicopter Kim drops through the ventilation shafts of the building, to seize the vile plans of the bad guys.

Name: Cubes à Jouer: Je saute et je prends
Description:
This is an roll dice race game. First player plays a cricket, the second player play a toucan (that will capture the cricket if he arrives on a case where the cricket is), the third player plays a monkey (that will eat the toucan if he arrives on it) and so on. Note that when there are less than 6 players, a player may choose to play with the first unstarted animal to have two or more animals
 The player who brings the cricket (may be after having eated it or even having eaten some animal that did eat the cricket) to the final square wins the game

Name: Flotilla
Description:
FLOTILLA is an innovative wargame system which combines board game organisation with the visual appeal of scale miniatures. The initial boxed set contains comprehensive rules for naval and air combat in the WWII era, but the system is designed to encompass integrated land combat and adapt to any historical period, facilitating play at strategic, tactical and skirmish level.

The system will be expanded by additional modules which are in preparation.
FLOTILLA Wargame System.

Website http://www.clydeside-flotilla.com/

Name: Boxum Animal Zoo
Description:
"This new game will teach the alphabet and increase the ability to make decisions."

Players use a spinner to match letters contained in animal names (example: B=Bear) to box in all of the letters on the gameboard.

Includes 4 alphabet game boards, 4 sets of zoo cards, 4 sets of pegs, 1 animal zoo game board, dice, and rules.

Designed for children ages 3 to 10.

Name: Race Roulette
Description:
Race Roulette is a horseracing game. Horses are moved by a roulette. This roulette indicates what horse can move (color) and how far it runs (numbers).
Like in normal horseracing, every player chooses 1, 2 or 3 horses to play with. When all the horses of a player arrived, that players wins.

Multiplayer-version of the game: every player chooses a unique combination of two/three horses. The player with the right combination/tiercé wins the game.

Name: Eläinystävät lammella
Description: Cute little duck and the frog boy are swimming around the pond, trying to reach a large rock. If you throw a dice right color, you'll go to the next leaf. The first one to reach big rock wins. This can also be used as a memory game. Easy and fun to play the smallest family!

Name: Eläinystävät maalla
Description: Animal themed memory game where the players are looking for a farm animal parts. Gather the animals line up in front of you - the winner is the one who has the longest line when all the animals have been found. A draw occurs Samu Frog will help you to victory! Easy and fun memory game youngest family!

Name: Rhyme Bag
Description: Rhyme Bag could be used with in large group of children or just with one child. Rhyme Bag includes 24 rhyme cards. One side of the card there is a rhyme and on the other side there is a colourful picture matching the rhyme. Rhymes are new! Never published before. The more rhymes you get, the more points you earn!

Name: Suomi Tietopeli Matkaversio
Description: The game includes a total of 600 Finland concerning questions! By responding to the questions you tick off the pyramid in your subject areas. You be the first to check off 5 circles, you are a winner!

Name: System Vector:  Breakdown of Mass
Description:
The Breakdown of Mass is the next installment for System Vector, which is becoming a favorite game of mine in general. 
The expansion does not focus much on a large amount of new units or system cards. Instead, it adds more depth to the game it's self by adding more elements to game play and strategy. The expansion includes 6 new high-resource system cards, a Black Hole system, and an Unknown system. 
In addition to these, the game also features a new building aspect, where you can build structures such as factories, science institutes, and mobile shipyards. Each of these structures improves different aspects of your empire, making the games focus wider and your empire larger. With these buildings also come the chance to research and develop new technology and advancements in your empire. There will be a military technology tier, and an economical technology tier. These tiers will have 2 options per level of advancement. This will give players 4 Research Management Cards and 48 Research counters (12 for each player).

That makes 13 new cards to print out, which at 25 cents a print, comes to $3.25.

8 System cards (including the Black Hole and Unknown System)
4 Research Management cards
1 Research Counters sheet

I am really excited to be getting another System Vector game off the ground. I am lucky to be able to pop things like this out within a couple of days, while still being able to test play Armed Legion AND learn/play RftG. fun fun.

Name: Space War I.: The Burning Stars
Description:
Space War is a fast playing Space Combat and Strategy Game. Two Players (in the Basic Version and up to 12 in the extended Versions) You have the Choice to conquer the Space, to travel with their Ships in the Hyperspace and Attack the Enemy wherever they can. Building of Ships, Bases and Conquering Planets with Landing Troops, is the Target of the Game. But to Attack your Enemies Planets you must defeat the Fleets of his Force first. The winner is who has cleared the Space from its Enemy... But be Carefull your Fleets didnt come exactley where you have sent it every time...

German Description:
Space War ist ein schnell spielbares Weltraumkampf und -strategiespiel für 2 bis 12 Spieler (Basisversion nur 2 Spieler).
Ihr habt die Wahl den Weltraum zu erobern! Eure Schiffe reisen durch den Hyperraum und greifen den Feind an wo immer Sie Ihn finden. Mächtige Sternenschiffe und Basen bauen, und die feindlichen Planeten mit Landungstruppen zu überrennen ist das Ziel. Doch um das zu erreichen müsst Ihr zuerst die Flotten der gegnersichen streitmächte schlagen. Der Sieger ist jener Spieler welcher zuerst die Galaxis von seinen Feinden gesäubert hat...

Name: Space War II.: The Road to Karaganda
Description:
German Description:
Der Rat der Confederate Stars Administration (C.S.A.) gibt bekannt:
Um die Streitigkeiten wegen des, äußerst rohstoffreichen, Sonnensystems
KARAGANDA zu beenden findet ein Wettrennen dorthin statt. Jenes Sternenreich
welches zuerst einen von intelligenten Lebewesen bewohnten Planeten in das
umstrittene Sonnensystem bringt hat das Rennen gewonnen. Das Bombardement
der Planeten von Mitbewerbern ist verboten und wird mit Ausschluß aus dem
galaktischen Rat bestraft. Planeten von Mitbewerbern können jedoch erobert
werden wenn der eigene Planet durch Unfall oder Eroberung verlorengegangen ist.
Alle Planeten beginnen das Rennen am gleichen Tag.

Der Weg nach Karaganda... ist ein Weltraumstrategiespiel für 2 - 8 Spieler ab 12 Jahren.
Im Gegensatz zu "die brennenden Sterne" Wird Karaganda als Geschwaderkampf basierendes System gespielt. Natürlich können, alternativ auch die Raumgefechtsregeln davon verwendet werden!
Ihr müßt eure Welt ins Zentrum des Sektors, zum Karaganda
Sonnensystem bringen. Dabei sind verschiedene Hindernisse, wie Schwarze Löcher, Minenfelder, Asteroidenfelder, Dunkelwolken und Hyperstürme, zu überwinden.
Außerdem sind da noch eure Mitspieler die euch die Hölle heiß machen wo sie nur
können...

English Description:
The Council from the "Confederate Stars Administration" (C.S.A.) announces: To End The disputes about the, extremely raw material-rich, solar system KARAGANDA,  The race wich takes place there. That star realm which first places one planet inhabited from intelligent organisms, into that disputed solar system, has won. The bombardment of planets from competitors is forbidden and will be punished with exclusion from the galactic council. Planets of competitors can however conquered if the own planet by accident or conquest was lost. All planets begin the running on the same day. "The Road to Karaganda! is a space strategy game for 2 - 8 players starting from 12 years. Contrary to "The burning stars" Karaganda has a squadron fighting based system. Naturally, alternatively the space engagements rulesof the other Game can be used! You must bring your world in the center of the sector, to the Karaganda Solar system.Many Different obstacles, like black holes, Mine fields, Asteroidfields, dark clouds and hyperstorms must be overwhelmed. In addition your fellow players are making you the hell, where  ever they can...

Name: Tally Rally
Description: Think Boggle with numbers, but instead of spelling out words, you're racing to put together equations. Tally Rally challenges math skills by requiring children to spot addition, subtraction, multiplication and division equations to win.

Name: Picture Puzzles
Description:
A simple word deduction game from the 1930s, produced as part of a series by Party Game Publishers (PGP) of Luton in Bedfordshire, England.

The games consist of 18 cards (games), each of which is printed with a black and white line drawing. Beneath the drawing is a cryptic clue to look for something in the drawing - for example, the drawing might be of two boxers fighting, and the cryptic clue might be, "spot the drink". The answer is "punch", which is something depicted in the drawing and which is also a drink.

The purpose of the game is for each player to see all 18 cards, and solve as many of the clues as they can within a set time.

Good production values - cards are heavy duty and well printed - but limited replay value, as once you have worked out the clues on each card there is no point in playing the game again as you know all of the answers. Simple pleasures for simple folk.

Name: ... aber bitte mit Sahne: Das Joker-Stück
Description:
A mini-expansion for the game Piece o' Cake: the 'wild card' part of the pie has all the fruits depicted on it. The Joker is mixed with the other components. When the Joker is played during the game, it's submitted immediately to any variety that you collect OR you can eat it and get 2 points.

This expansion appeared in the April 2009 edition of Spielbox Magazine.

Name: Pizza-Express
Description:
Ein Spiel für 2 - 6 Spieler um heiße Pizzen und um ebensolche Reifen...
Mach deinen Pizza-Express zum besten in der Stadt...

English Description:
Hot Pizza and hot Wheels...
drive your Pizza-Express delivery Service to the best in the City...

The Game is Based in this early Variant (Later Variants are in the Phase of Planing) on a Hex Grid with Numbers inside like Sttlers from catan. All Players are setting there Pizza Express Central on a field with a "2" marked in the Center. The Numbers represented the Amount of Fees you must pay to the owner of the Building (Landlord?) every Round. The Starting Player rolls two dice on the random Events Table. Then he rolls for the field where the Pizza Couriers, must deliver their Pizzas. Every Player has one starting Courier. The first one is roling a Die to determine the Number of Crossing Points, his Driver could move this Turn. After this he moves his first driver as Near as Possible to a field with a Number rolled as Target field. If he reachs a crossing point adjacent to the target field he is earning the Printed Number multiplied with 100. These are the Pizza Units or PU (PE in German).  But not PUs are the Target of the Game! The Victory depends on Victory Points based on Quality, Price and a Cutt throug rate of Delivery Times from the Pizza Orders.

I Personally like this Game but the realy simple Grafics of the Game had once avoided any succes on the Market. So i decided to release the Game with better Artwork in 2010 hopefully...

No English rules Available yet but in Praparation Status!

Name: Mappa-Mundi
Description:
Produced by Waddingtons in the 1920's.

Two games in one; a jigsaw board of the world, combined with a general knowledge game where players have to correctly identify the locations of capitals of the world. However, the general knowledge part of the game cannot be played until the jigsaw board has been completed.

The jigsaw was 32" x 18", and at the time of production was the largest cardboard jigsaw ever made.

Game contents:

1 map of the world in the form of a 32" x 18" jigsaw
1 paper map of the world (as a reference for the jigsaw)
4 sets of capital city counters (red, blue, green and white)

In the general knowledge part of the game, each player in turn tries to correctly place a capital city on the jigsaw board.

If they correctly place the capital city, they score 4 points.
If they cannot place the capital city, they can put it to one side and score 0 points.
If they incorrectly place the capital city, they lose 2 points.

The winner is the player with the most points.

The game was something of a rarity even when in production; it was expensive, and the general knowledge part of the game was an obvious afterthought. However, it is prized by collectors of vintage jigsaws, and has some curiosity value for the now-obsolete names used for countries on the map - for example Siam, Persia, Arabia and Ceylon. Definitely a remnant of the British Empire ;)

Name: Sumeria: 2-Player Expansion
Description:
A two-player expansion of the Sumeria board game, released as a promo for the game at Essen '09. It adds 24 more wooden pieces (6 in each of the original player colours) bringing the total to 20 per player. It also includes a sheet of rules and a sticker to show the 4th player turn which only happens in the 2-player game. The whole thing comes packaged in a baggie and cannot be played without the base game.

Expands:

    Sumeria

Name: War of Bugs
Description:
WAR OF BUGS is a step-by-step strategy board game for 2 or more players.

The main feature is that you can use everything to be the battlefield table, stairwell, park, living room and so on. Bugs will climb, jump, fly and fight amidst the landscape and stuff thrown around.
That's why the game is about bugs -they can get everywhere.

Now the game is absolutely free and works on «DOWNLOAD, PRINT & PLAY» principle.

* Players make moves by turn, trying to seize opponent's artifact
 * Bugs crawl, climb, fly, jump, fight, seize and defend bases and artifacts
 * Bases produce bugs

The goal is to defeat all opponents.
The player is defeated when the opponent's bug seizes his artifact.
